articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: German police said on Saturday that they were still searching for an unknown assailant hours after he killed three people and wounded others in a stabbing attack at a festival in the western city of Solingen.
articles.title: German police search for assailant in festival stabbing that killed 3

articles.author: Ismail Shakil, Stephanie Kelly
articles.description: Independent presidential candidate Robert F. Kennedy Jr. abanonded his campaign on Friday and endorsed Republican Donald Trump, ending a presidential bid that he began as a Democrat trading on one of the most famous names in American politics.
articles.title: RFK Jr ends US presidential campaign, endorses Trump

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia and Ukraine are set to exchange 115 prisoners on Saturday following mediation from the United Arab Emirates, an Emirati official told Reuters
articles.title: Russia, Ukraine set to swap 115 prisoners, UAE official says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Italian prosecutor has opened a manslaughter investigation into the deaths of British tech magnate Mike Lynch and six other people who were killed when a luxury yacht sank off Sicily this week.
articles.title: Italian prosecutor opens manslaughter inquiry in Lynch yacht sinking

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Hamas delegation will arrive in Cairo on Saturday evening to hear from mediators on the latest round of Gaza ceasefire negotiations that took place in the Egyptian capital, senior Hamas official Izzat al-Rishq said in a statement.
articles.title: Hamas delegation heads to Cairo on Saturday to discuss Gaza ceasefire talks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian attack killed at least five civilians and wounded five others on Saturday in the eastern Ukrainian town of Kostiantynivka, a regional governor said.
articles.title: Russian attack kills five people in eastern Ukraine town, governor says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A French police officer was injured on Saturday when a blazing car exploded in the car park of a synagogue in the coastal town of La Grande-Motte, local media reported, and police said they were treating the incident as attempted arson.
articles.title: French police officer hurt in suspected arson attack in front of synagogue

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy has signed a law on Ukraine ratifying the Rome Statute, allowing the country to join the International Criminal Court (ICC).
articles.title: Zelenskiy signs law on Ukraine ratifying Rome Statute

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A bomb blast in southwestern Pakistan killed two children and injured 16 people on Saturday, police officials said.
articles.title: Pakistan bomb blast kills two children, injures 16 people

articles.author: Jennifer Rigby
articles.description: The first 10,000 mpox vaccines are finally due to arrive next week in Africa, where a dangerous new strain of the virus - which has afflicted people there for decades - has caused global alarm.
articles.title: Why mpox vaccines are only just arriving in Africa after two years
